front.title: A well-known URI for publishing service parameters

abstract.t: We define a well-known URI at which an HTTP origin can inform an authoritative DNS server, or other interested parties, about its Service Bindings. Service binding data can include Encrypted ClientHello (ECH) configurations, that may change frequently. This allows the origin, in collaboration with DNS infrastructure elements, to publish and rotate its own ECH keys. Other service bindng data such as information about TLS supported groups is unlikely to change quickly, but the origin is much more likely to have accurate information when changes do occur. Service data published via this mechanism is typically available via an HTTPS or SVCB resource record.
